title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk: Updates for Norfolk on Wednesday, 6 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: british museum expert says cuts to norfolk 's archaeology service would be a `` tragedy '' .
prince george starts at norfolk nursery .
ninety new houses could get the go-ahead for the outskirts of wymondham .
happisburgh lighthouse is marking its 225th year this week .
more news , sport , weather and travel from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: thanks for joining us today and hope you 've enjoyed our coverage .
norfolk live will be back with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather fro 08:00 tomorrow morning .
keep in touch via email , twitter or facebook .

documents.title: weather : cooler with cloud and rain overnight
text: clear spells at first but rain , heavy at times , will arrive from the west later , with temperatures falling to 5c ( 41f ) .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: happisburgh lighthouse in
text: we 've been looking at the history of happisburgh lighthouse throughout the day as it marks 225 years of watching over the southern north sea .

it 's something of a mecca for photographers , so here 's a selection of some of the stunning images you 've been sending us , which includes a number of contributions from the norfolk countryside photos group on facebook .
many thanks .

documents.title: norfolk tops country 's list of historical buried artifacts
text: norfolk is the top place in the country when it comes to archaeological finds and any cuts to the county 's archaeological unit , which helps identify treasure , would be a `` disaster '' according to a former british musem professor .
people will go on searching for objects and finding them , but they wo n't have anyone to report them to or anyone who can record that information which tells us so much about the past . ''

the county council is having to find budget savings and is currently consulting on whether to cut £ 170,000 from its archaeology service , including the portable antiquities unit which identifies treasure items .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: kensington palace of prince george 's first day at nursery
text: the duke and duchess of cambridge have released two of prince george 's first day attending westacre montessori nursery in norfolk .
the show the toddler standing in front of a mural outside the nursery , which is close to the duke and duchess of cambridge 's home , anmer hall .

documents.title: your happisburgh lighthouse
text: the red and white stripes of happisburgh lighthouse on the north norfolk coast has been popular with photographers for many years .
it was built in 1791 to a design by william wilkins .
thanks to mark spurgeon for this image , as we say `` happis-burgh-day '' to the lighthouse .

documents.title: headlines : norfolk mp calling for nhs review prince george 's first day at westacre nursery
text: the main stories this evening :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: 'live ' world war two ammunition found at building site
text: raf bomb disposal experts say the bombs and mortars unearthed at king 's lynn town hall earlier today were practise ordnance from world war two .
the site was cleared this morning when the bombs , mortars and some ammunition were uncovered by workmen carrying out a town hall renovation project .
building work resumed after disposal experts removed the items .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: prince george 's first day at nursery
text: two .
of prince george have been released , showing him on his first day at the westacre montessori nursery in norfolk .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: photos show prince george at nursery
text: the duke and duchess have released 2 photos to mark prince george 's first day at westacre montessori school nursery

documents.title: it 's a tv flashback : happisburgh lighthouse 1998
text: the red and white happisburgh lighthouse has towered over the norfolk coast for 225 years .
but as shaun peel reports , the red and white paint job has proved problematic .
in the early '90s a television `` makeover '' did n't quite last the course , and decorators had to return some years later .

documents.title: 'scorcher ' winter weather explained
text: we 've just had the warmest december on record , but what caused it to happen ?
look east weather forecaster dan holley explains .

documents.title: big bird 'on the loose ' in terrington st clement
text: a large bird that is native to south america has been on the loose in terrington st clement , police say .
officers received calls at around 11:00 to reports of a rhea , described as being similar in size to an ostrich , emerging from a children 's playing field on the station road junction .
drivers later reported it being on the a17 .
police say despite their investigations , they 've not found the bird and ca n't be sure if it has returned to its home or been recaptured by its owner .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: parliamentary review of nhs called by former health minister
text: the north norfolk mp norman lamb is calling for a parliamentary review into what a future nhs will look like .

the announcement comes as a bbc investigation reveals a large number of gp practices in england are closing their doors to new patients because of staff shortages , and as junior doctors prepare to go on strike next week .
`` this dispute must be settled without delay .
it would be disastrous if we drift into a strike which could have a significant impact on patients . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: weather : mostly cloudy with showers moving inland
text: this afternoon will see a shower or two possible in coastal towns , and staying gloomy but dry elsewhere .
top temperature 9c ( 48f ) .
weather has more local details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: flood alerts for river waveney and deben no longer in force
text: diss express reports the flood alert issued on the river waveney is no longer in force , the environment agency has confirmed .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: watch : happisburgh lighthouse celebrates 225 years
text: happisburgh lighthouse , in north norfolk , built after a huge loss of life during a storm in 1789 , is 225 years old this week .
it 's now the only independently operated lighthouse in the country .
author: Mike Liggins
BBC Look East

documents.title: police search addresses following arrests on sus of firearms offences
text: police have searched properties on unthank road in norwich and in dickleburgh this morning after two people were arrested on sus of firearms offences .
a man in his 60s and a teenage boy were arrested yesterday , questioned , and then released on bail until march .
an army bomb disposal unit was involved in the search yesterday .
three sus packages were found to be harmless .
author: Nicky Price
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: happisburgh lighthouse celebrates 225 years of saving souls at sea
text: the north norfolk landmark was built in response to huge losses of life and ships during a storm in october 1789 and remains the country 's only independently run lighthouse .
it 's been the subject of many photographs over the years and we would love to see your images of the lighthouse which is celebrating its 225th anniversary .
you can get in touch via email , twitter or facebook .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: local health provider reveals more than £ 1m of medicines wasted
text: the great yarmouth and waveney clinical commissioning group is urging people to only take the prescriptions they need after figures show more than £ 1m of unused medicines are wasted by the east of the county each year .
of the £ 1.06m worth of unused medicines the group estimates :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: explosives in king 's lynn said to be `` smoke mortars ''
text: world war one `` smoke mortars '' are believed to be among a pile of ammunition recovered by builders working on a new heritage lottery building in king 's lynn earlier .
the area around the town hall was evacuated while bomb disposal experts removed the items , which included bullets .
the site will house the stories of lynn heritage lottery project which details the history of king 's lynn and is due to open later this year .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: headlines : evacuated area of king 's lynn returns to normal after ammunition found by builders more than £ 1m of unused medicines are wasted in east norfolk annually
text: the main news stories this lunchtime :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: ammunition found at king 's lynn heritage lottery building site
text: the area around the town hall in king 's lynn has been evacuated after builders found bullets and explosives on site .
they were working on the last stages of a heritage lottery project when they came across the ammunition .
bomb disposal experts and the police are currently at the scene , but a cafe owner whose premises overlooks the site has not been told not to close her shop .
basically they 've brought up some objects as they carried out building work .
raf bomb disposal are here , the builders have told me it 's turned out to be a smoke bomb and there 's nothing to worry about . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: police arrive at scene where bombs and bullets found
text: norfolk police have arrived at the scene in king 's lynn where a stash of bullets and bombs are reported to have been found on a building site behing the town hall .
we 'll bring you more details as we get them .
if you are there and have a to share , email us or send it via twitter .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: breakingbombs and bullets stash found in king 's lynn
text: bomb disposal experts are on their way to king 's lynn after reports of bullets and shells being found in granary court , behind the town hall .
norfolk police say the immediate area has been evacuated and people wo n't be allowed there until the disposal team has arrived .
the suspected bullets and shells were found on a building site .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: norfolk lighthouse celebrates 225th anniversary
text: happisburgh lighthouse , an icon on the north norfolk skyline , reaches its 225th anniversary this week as a beacon guiding mariners safe passage in the southern north sea .
it 's the oldest working lighthouse in east anglia and the only independently operated working lighthouse in the united kingdom .
to celebrate the lighthouse 's trust is hoping to raise £ 25,000 for refurbishments to the 96 step staircase , as well as allowing visitor tours on 15 weekends from easter onwards .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: blessing of the land and tractors
text: norfolk county farms has just posted this about plough sunday , the revival of a a traditional english celebration marking the beginning of the agricultural year :
find out more about plough sunday here : check out your local church for services near you .

documents.title: man dies after collision on new year 's eve
text: a man in his 70s has died after sustaining serious injuries after being hit by a car on the a148 at high kelling .
a white mini cooper , travelling towards sheringham , struck a pedestrian on the a148 on cromer road , about 17:00 on new year 's eve .
police are still keen to speak to anyone with information .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: on the back page : elliot 's farewell to city
text: city winger teams up with lambert again at blackburn :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: decision on new showroom for classic lotus racing cars due today
text: classic team lotus finds out today if it 's got backing to build a new showroom and building for its vintage racing cars .
south norfolk councillors will decide if it should be allowed to build a new large building on the hethel site off potash lane .
the plot has had planning permission refused in the past .

documents.title: cuts to norfolk 's archaeology service would be a 'tragedy ' , says professor
text: an expert from the british museum says proposed cuts to norfolk 's archaeology service would be a `` tragedy '' .
prof roger bland has just retired from the british museum and now lives in cley .
the norfolk archaeological unit recorded 15,000 finds in 2015 .
the county council is running a public consultation on whether to cut posts .
author: Nicky Price
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: on the front page : shotgun tragedy of popular councillor
text: inquest unable to reach definite conclusion on man 's death :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: additional car parking investment in holt not on agenda
text: now is not the right time to invest in additional car parking in the north norfolk town of holt , councillors say .
the authority says 150 spaces are already being created by private developers , so for now it would be a financial risk .
the council says it is n't ruling out investment in the future .

documents.title: on the front page : day of shame for drink-drive motorist
text: eight motorists appear before city magistrates and admit to drink-driving :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: a140 shut in both directions at long stratton
text: the a140 is closed in both directions between hill farm road and hall lane following a crash between a van and a lorry .
there 's queuing traffic in both directions .
travel has more details .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: investigation says gp practices in east refusing new patients
text: a bbc investigation suggests that at least 100 gp practices in england have stopped taking on new patients , or have applied to .
in the east , nine practices have applied to close their lists , with 20 more generally not accepting new patients .
many surgeries have a shortage of family doctors , but nhs england says it 's investing £ 15m to boost numbers .
author: Matt Precey
BBC Look East

documents.title: more housing planned for wymondham area
text: ninety new houses could get the go ahead for outskirts of wymondham later today .
the development would be behind an existing estate on silfield road .
planners have raised some concerns about junctions and landscaping , which they say need reviewing .
author: Nicky Price
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: canaries winger bennett joins blackburn
text: norwich city 's elliott bennett has joined championship side blackburn rovers on a two-and-a-half year deal .
the 27-year-old has spent much of the season on-loan at bristol city , after struggling to get into alex neil 's squad .
bennett teams up with former norwich boss paul lambert , who signed him for the canaries in 2011 .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : fog and scattered showers
text: early mist and fog patches will clear during the morning to leave a mostly cloudy day .
feeling chillier today with a top temperature of just 6c ( 42f ) .
more weather details from bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : british museum expert says archaeology service cuts a 'tragedy ' go-ahead expected for 90 new houses
text: the main news stories :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: hello and welcome to norfolk live
text: we 're here to bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
if you have any stories you think we should know about or wish to share a photo , you can get in touch via email , twitter or facebook .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live
